subject: Tennis
lead_paragraph: Maria Sharapova has been told that she will not be considered for the Russian Fed Cup team that will face Italy in the final in September. That decision, by the Russian Fed Cup captain Shamil Tarpishchev, could affect her chances of playing in the 2008 Beijing Olympics.A shoulder injury forced Sharapova to pull out of the semifinal last week against the United States, once again delaying her Fed Cup debut.“I feel it would be incorrect to invite Sharapova to play against Italy as we reached the final without her,” Tarpishchev said.According to the rules of the Russian federation, only those players who perform on the country’s teams in Davis Cup or Fed Cup can be considered for Olympic selection.
